Operation 'Createnewsession' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about what constitutes the response (201 status code and response schema details). Added domain context ('customer browsing session'), clarified namespace handling, specified return status code, and improved AI agent interpretability by explicitly stating what is returned and when this operation should be used.

data.current_description:
Creates a new session and returns a session token and a segment token. Also stores `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies, with the same values returned in the response.

All parameters in the body that are not within the public namespace will be ignored. Query string items will automatically be added to the public namespace.

> The Session Manager API uses the `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies to store the data required to identify the user and the session. These cookies are stored in the user's browser when the session is created and sent automatically in every request to that domain. You will have to reproduce that by sending these cookies as headers in other requests to Session Manager API in order for it to work outside of a browser environment.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new customer browsing session and returns session and segment tokens. The operation stores `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies with the same values in the response. Only parameters within the `public` namespace in the request body are processed; query string parameters are automatically added to the public namespace. Returns a 201 response containing the session token, segment token, and session metadata. No authentication required.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about what constitutes the response (201 status code and response schema details). Added domain context ('customer browsing session'), clarified namespace handling, specified return status code, and improved AI agent interpretability by explicitly stating what is returned and when this operation should be used.

data.current_description:
Retrieves information from a previously created sesssion.

 > The Session Manager API uses the `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies to store the data required to identify the user and the session. These cookies are stored in the user's browser when the session is created and sent automatically in every request to that domain. You will have to reproduce that by sending these cookies as headers to Session Manager API in order for it to work outside of a browser environment.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a previously created session, including cookies, query strings, authentication credentials, and current profile/pricing data. Requires the `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies (or tokens) to be sent as headers to identify the session. Returns a 200 response with the session object containing all stored session data. No authentication required.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too vague. Added specificity about required headers, clarified what session information is retrieved (per API description), specified return status, and improved AI agent understanding of when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'Editsession' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too generic. Description is verbose and unclear about the conditional behavior (new vs. update). Missing explicit input requirements (which cookies/headers needed) and output details (what is returned). Added clarity about the conditional logic (update if cookies present, create if not), specified required headers, clarified namespace handling, and improved AI agent interpretability by making the operation's behavior and prerequisites explicit.

data.current_description:
Edits information from a previously created sesssion.

 This endpoint works the same way as the [Create new session](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/session-manager-api#post-/api/sessions) endpoint, but when the request is sent with a `vtex_session` and the `vtex_segment` cookies in the header, it retrieves the session first and then applies the changes instead of generating a new one.

Only keys inside the `public` namespace in the request body are considered, and query parameters are automatically added to the public namespace.

> The Session Manager API uses the `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies to store the data required to identify the user and the session. These cookies are stored in the user's browser when the session is created and sent automatically in every request to that domain. You will have to reproduce that by sending these cookies as headers to Session Manager API in order for it to work outside of a browser environment.
 
## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing session by modifying its data. Requires `vtex_session` and `vtex_segment` cookies (or tokens) in the request headers to identify the session to update. Only properties within the `public` namespace in the request body are processed; query parameters are automatically added to the public namespace. Returns a 200 response with the updated session object. If cookies are not provided, creates a new session instead. No authentication required.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description is verbose and unclear about the conditional behavior (new vs. update). Missing explicit input requirements (which cookies/headers needed) and output details (what is returned). Added clarity about the conditional logic (update if cookies present, create if not), specified required headers, clarified namespace handling, and improved AI agent interpretability by making the operation's behavior and prerequisites explicit.

message: Operation 'GetSegment' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is too vague and lacks domain context. Description is unclear about what inputs are accepted, what the response contains, and the distinction between temporary query overrides and persistent session changes. Added domain terminology ('customer segment', 'navigation parameters'), clarified optional query parameters and their behavior, specified response structure (200 status, segment object with properties), and improved AI agent understanding of when to use this vs. the Edit session endpoint.

data.current_description:
Retrieves information about the segment, which contains additional data related to the session's context.

You can add certain public fields as the query string and the system will attempt to fulfill it. Values such as `cultureInfo` and `utm` are overwriteable, just keep in mind such changes will not be reflected in the client's session.

If you wish to change the value on the session (and thus be reflected on the segment without special query strings), then use the [Edit session](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/session-manager-api#patch-/api/sessions) endpoint.

## Permissions

This endpoint does not require [authentication](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/authentication) or [permissions](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/license-manager-resources--3q6ztrC8YynQf6rdc6euk3).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves segment information containing contextual data about the customer's browsing session, including shared navigation parameters with similar users. Accepts optional query string parameters (e.g., `cultureInfo`, `utm`) to customize the segment response; these overrides are temporary and not persisted to the session. Returns a 200 response with the segment object containing up to 12 properties describing the customer segment. To permanently modify segment data, use the Edit session endpoint. No authentication required.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too vague and lacks domain context. Description is unclear about what inputs are accepted, what the response contains, and the distinction between temporary query overrides and persistent session changes. Added domain terminology ('customer segment', 'navigation parameters'), clarified optional query parameters and their behavior, specified response structure (200 status, segment object with properties), and improved AI agent understanding of when to use this vs. the Edit session endpoint.
